description: GTK developers have been holding another hackfest this week for the annual FOSDEM developer conference happening this weekend in Brussels. GTK developers are working toward the GTK 4.18 stable release and continuing to think more about GTK 5...
title: GTK's X11 Backend Now Deprecated, Planned For Removal In GTK 5

description: Merged on Friday to the Linux 6.14 kernel were the Kbuild feature changes for this cycle. Most notable with these kernel build changes is the introduction of the gendwarfksyms tool that is used as part of the ongoing Rust programming language push within the Linux kernel...
title: gendwarfksyms Tool Added To Linux 6.14 To Help With Rust Push

description: During the month of January on Phoronix were 292 original Linux/open-source related news articles and another 13 featured-length Linux hardware reviews and other multi-page benchmark specials. Here's a look back at the most exciting Linux/open-source news and content over the past month...
title: Intel Battlemage, NVIDIA RTX 50 & Linux Kernel Excitement From January

description: The RISC-V CPU architecture feature updates have now been submitted and merged for the nearly-over Linux 6.14 merge window...
title: Linux 6.14 RISC-V Kernel Adds Support For T-Head Vector Extensions, GhostWrite

description: KDE developer Nate Graham is out with his traditional weekly recap of all the interesting KDE Plasma changes for the past week. With less than two weeks until the Plasma 6.3 stable release, Nate Graham began his weekly update by remarking that the Plasma 6.3 desktop is "looking pretty good!"..
title: KDE Plasma 6.3: "It's Looking Pretty Good!"
